author: profd2004
title: Opensource PHP SDK for COTI ADA Pay
description: PHP es utilizado por más del 75% de todos los sitios web, pero no existe un SDK nativo de Cardano de alta calidad para soportar el pago de ADA.

f6_assessments.q0:
La propuesta está completamente alineada con el desafío y me parece que el enfoque de crear primero un SDK de PHP para la integración de COTI AdaPay y luego los plugins para Woocommerce y Laravel es realmente inteligente y una buena manera de optimizar el desarrollo utilizando un enfoque modular.
La elección de utilizar PHP, teniendo en cuenta su amplia adopción para el desarrollo de sitios web en el mundo, es perfecta y podría proporcionar un gran impulso para la adopción de COTI AdaPay y en consecuencia para la adopción y la difusión de Cardano.
La estrella que falta es debido a la falta de detalles sobre la experiencia del usuario para el pago (hay una mención sobre la interfaz de usuario sólo desde la perspectiva del comerciante), pero se menciona explícitamente en el resumen del desafío para describir lo que será la experiencia del usuario para los clientes.
f6_assessments.q1:
Los proponentes con su iniciativa "Lidonation" son miembros conocidos de la comunidad y ya consiguieron algunas propuestas financiadas, y, según su perfil de linkedin podrían tener las habilidades requeridas para el desarrollo del proyecto presentado.
Al mismo tiempo, no hay ningún enlace en github a proyectos anteriores desarrollados. La única indicación sobre proyectos anteriores desarrollados utilizando las habilidades requeridas para la propuesta, son:
- el sitio web lidonation que parece estar desarrollado en Laravel como se indica en la propuesta
- el sitio web https://electricbikereview.com/ que está desarrollado en Wordpress.
Hubiera sido bueno explicar qué plugins personalizados se desarrollaron para el sitio web mencionado y, si es posible, compartir el repo de código para tener una mejor comprensión de las habilidades de los proponentes. Por el momento, con sólo la información proporcionada no es posible tener una visión completa sobre ella.
Desde un punto de vista técnico, sería bueno proporcionar más información sobre algunos aspectos técnicos: ¿para qué versión de PHP se desarrollará el SDK? ¿Qué paquetes ya desarrollados se utilizarán? ¿Se publicará en packagist y estará disponible a través de composer?
Se menciona el soporte telefónico y por correo electrónico para los comerciantes, pero no se indica durante cuánto tiempo se mantendrá el SDK y los plugins, sería bueno añadir este tipo de detalles.
El desglose del presupuesto se compone de sólo 2 partes: Desarrollo y soporte.
Estaría bien tener un desglose más detallado y ver cuánto pesan las distintas partes del desarrollo en el coste total (por ejemplo, horas estimadas para el desarrollo del SDK, la documentación, las pruebas, el desarrollo de los plugins de Wordpress, el desarrollo del paquete de Laravel). El coste indicado de 65 dólares/hora es bastante elevado (aunque sé que puede diferir mucho de un país a otro) y sería bueno justificarlo más a fondo.
Sería bueno incluir un cronograma o hitos para la entrega de las distintas partes del proyecto, por el momento sólo es posible estimar que el desarrollo tomará 320 horas.
f6_assessments.q2:
Como se dijo en la viabilidad, la propuesta carece de una hoja de ruta y un calendario para la entrega de las distintas partes del proyecto, y este tipo de información podría ser fundamental para ayudar a la comunidad a seguir el progreso de la propuesta.
No se indican KPI, para este proyecto sería bueno hacer un seguimiento:
- Github commits / issues / milestone para el desarrollo de cada parte (SDK, Laravel plugin, Wordpress Plugin)
- Número de sitios web que utilizan / descargas del SDK / plugin de Wordpress / paquete de Laravel
- Número de transacciones completadas utilizando el SDK (e indicar una manera de mantener un seguimiento de ellos, como una firma en la comunicación con el COTI AdaPay API)
- Número de correos electrónicos / llamadas telefónicas de soporte

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets the challenge set in the fund and looks to help develop an SDK that can be used to integrate a plug-in to PHP-based items.  This scalable to people building websites using PHP as the base server-side language, which is a popular one, with WordPress as an example.
f6_assessments.q1: There is relevant experience in the team to deliver such a project with vast experience developing front- and back-end solutions.   There are little details on how the execution would go, but details on what the solution would include are available.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a description of what the solution is, but there is little details on how the solution will be built and the resources necessary for the project will be.  The additional funds allocated towards "technical support" are extensive and not really apart of the product development.

f6_assessments.q0: They identify the problem of integrating ADA pay into existing payment systems. They are already actively adding value to Cardano system themselves on other platforms and their PHP SDK will surely do the same if implemented successfully. They have a website ready for integration testing and that in itself is a KPI that aligns with the Challenge.  Adding more ecommerce related KPIs would have revealed the degree of alignment with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: They provide evidence of relevant skills with an already built website that is going to be the test playground for their first integration when their plugin is ready. Budget is broken down into identifiable items and seems reasonable for the tasks they plan to complete. They didn't provide any timetable to show when work gets completed. People need to know you have some goal of completing this project. Setting a time, also shows that you are committed. They explain in detail what is needed and how they will build this. They also consider the risk of not finding a suitable opensource framework and aim to work with Plutus developers from the community to build their own alternative solution.
f6_assessments.q2: They don't have a roadmap with milestones or KPIs in place. The one Milestone/KPI could be the website they have ready for testing their plugin. It would've been great to have more metrics to measure the performance of this project.  There is also no completion date. The problem and solution is clearly defined by creating an open source PHP SDK for ADA Pay. PHP already being used by many ecommerce websites.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has some good points in it and at the same time it is aligned with the main ideas of the challenge. The core idea of developing a plug-in that could be used in any Laravel or WordPress site has a good range of impact. The team seems to undoubtedly identify the problem within the challenge and if successful the proposal will certainly overcome this problem. Unfortunately, not many metrics were given which makes it difficult to assess if the team clearly knows how to determine if they are on the right track. Also, no concern with the scalability problem was shown which is worrying since it is a crucial point.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal shows some strong points to support the thesis that is a feasible proposal, but at the same time a lot of other points are missing. There is enough evidence that the team has relevant skills and experience that are needed. The budget proposed is within acceptable limits, but it is not broken down enough to determine if it has a fair value. Also, no timeline was proposed which is serious. Some more information such as a strategy in case additional funding is necessary or in case the team finds out they will not be able to meet the deadlines would be welcoming. Unexpected challenges regarding scalability and integrations could have been discussed as well.
f6_assessments.q2: There is very little evidence to show enough information was provided to audit the progress and success of the proposal. No relevant KPIs were discussed. The roadmap and milestones are not clear, and the timeline was not even discussed. Even if the problem was well described, the way the solution addresses the problem is not scrutinized. In turn, it makes it hard for anyone to gauge if progress is as expected at each stage.

f6_assessments.q0:
I am not sure behind the intent of this proposal. I will elaborate on my reasoning.

As a senior developer myself, i can surely say that the AdaPay integration via plugin should be the target of this challenge settings. However, this proposal takes this challenge a step further and talks about providing an SDK which will also be used for some already in progress project by the proposer. 

Therefore, to me it seems this is an additional point just for the sake of supporting this SDK development. In my opinion, to have adapay integration via plugin does not require or in any sense help further with meeting the goals of this challenge. Why would we need an SDK when a simple plugin integration with ecommerce sites is the  success criterion for this challenge settings. 

Therefore, i am more on the direction of disagreeing with this proposal in this challenge settings. My suggestion would have been to put this in open source challenge for cardano. But since, the proposal is well written and touch bases the plugin development for AdaPay, i will stay neutral and neither agree or disagree with it
f6_assessments.q1:
From the perspective of the experience, the relevant experience is given but details of the team is missing.

The main proposer is clearly quite active in Cardano eco system and perhaps has good experience with development. However, from the budget point of view it seems that there is only one developer (the proposer) who will be working on this project (atleast this is so becasue no other details of team is presented in this proposal).

There is also written that they might have to collaborate with plutus devs  to generate smart contract generator, but it is not really mentioned in proposal, how is smart contract generator fits into AdaPay solution integration with ecommerce. It would help  a lot to a simple voter (who is not coming from tech background) if the proposal is written in a manner that is visually clear, outlining the thoughts of proposer in text clearly. 

The budget outlined (in comparison to total allocation which is around 30% of total challenge budget) is on high side, when it does not even match up the success criterion of this challenge settings. e.g. " innovative plug-in that will be integrated with our current ADA Pay system on the one hand and support all the different e-commerce software mentioned above (both shopify and woocommerce)".  IMO there is no need of an SDK and removing that part will significantly bring down the costs to implement this proposal. There are other proposals in this challenge which fulfil exact success criterion of challenge in less budget.

Additionally, technical details such as QA (load testing, UAT), scalability metrics etc are missing. All in all , i feel there is a lot of improvement needed and also this might not be the good fit for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided here imo is not sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal. 

An overall budget is mentioned, but plan has not been broken down into milestones, feature sets etc. This proposal, therefore, imo has much room for improvement. 

For the community/voter it will give much more confidence when the proposer additionally gives a good break down of challenges/risks associated with the proposal. One risk, imo is that the if the main developer for some reason is unable to contribute then who others can basically pick up the responsibility to carry on the implementation of this project ? 

The positive is that proposer is open to collaborate with similar ideas, but nevertheless i feel that auditing the progress and success of this proposal requires more detailed information in terms of 3, 6, 12 months or weeks of deliverables. How the success will look like ? ON successful implementation, will there be OR how many businesses using the plugin/SDK ?

Most proposers plan on using API but by opting for an SDK you not only give the consumer the tools to implement ADA pay but you also give them your whole workspace so they are not bound by the boundaries of an API. Focusing on PHP is a solid decision since most e-comm and CMS platforms work on PHP.

The issue here is that they don't provide actual evidence to support this. They provide a link to their website but this provides only information about Cardano and not themselves. The roadmap is also missing which leaves us in the blue about what the proposers are really planning on doing. The budget breakdown is present but only rudimental. we need a deeper understanding as to why 12000 is needed for email/phone support.
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned in the above rationale no roadmap is provided what makes it hard to assess auditability as well. We do have some guidelines represented but this does not give the proper details about what still needs to happen and how much time it would take. Also think about metrics, How much adaption are you thinking about when making the oho SDK.
